title: Software Engineer
text:
118275 
(2 posts) 
BDLSS (Bodleian Digital Libraries Systems & Services) provides systems and services in support of the digital collections of the University of Oxford. These collections have expanded rapidly in recent years and include a wide variety of digitised resources. 
We are looking for two software engineers for fixed-term contracts of 1 year. You will work on a range of projects; specifically the development, management and enhancement of software for a range of collections and outputs; building on existing technical aspects of the collection including software development, upgrades, documentation and security. 
You will have a degree in a relevant subject or equivalent skills/experience and demonstrable knowledge and experience of: an object-orientated programming language; implementing and documenting complex software; requirement analysis and solution design; the design of web-user interfaces; version control and release management and testing systems. 
Due to the nature of this post, candidates will be required to have Disclosure Scotland and financial background checks. Possession of a criminal record or poor financial background will not necessarily prevent an applicant from obtaining this post as all cases are judged individually according to the nature of the role and the information provided. 
You will be required to upload a supporting statement as part of your online application. Your supporting statement should list each of the essential and desirable selection criteria, as listed in the further particulars, and explain how you meet each one. CVs will not form part of the selection process. As part of the interview process, please submit some samples of work in a suitable format, along with your application, that provide evidence that you meet the essential criteria listed in the job description. 
Only applications received online before 12:00 Midday (BST) on Monday 5 October 2015 can be considered. Interviews are expected to take place on 8 October 2015.
